intro: Oxytropis pamiroalajca, commonly known as the Pamir milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellow or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It is native to the high-altitude regions of the Pamir Mountains in Central Asia. Oxytropis pamiroalajca is adapted to cold, arid environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain.
